answers.answer: Hi.Your symptom could suggest disruption of nerve pathways along the leg to the spine. The finding is non-specific and could be caused by many conditions such as a nerve compression, peripheral neuropathy, diabetes, some endocrine disorders, etc.You should consult a physician if symptoms persist.Good luck.

question: My problem is I have recently; "like in the last week" started having an icy yet burning sensation in the shin of my right leg. There is not any pain with it. It started out just being when I was standing or walking but now it is starting to do it when I am sitting too. Its not sensitive to touch it nor does it feel cold to the touch. What could this be?
title: Don't have a clue??
